member.summary: Empty constructor
member.remarks: DO NOT REMOVE. It is mandatory for the serialization.

member.name: T:FireDogeWebBrowser.FavouritesEntity.Favourites
member.summary: This nested class represents the list of Bookmarked pages.
member.remarks: It is a nested class, the choice of such class can by debatable. We simply encapsulate a generic List beacause this class is Serializable and the generics like List can't be serialized So we needed to have a convenient object that we can serialize

member.name: F:FireDogeWebBrowser.FavouritesEntity.Favourites.favourites
member.summary: This is the reason why we need the Favourites class : We use a List which is not serializable

member.name: M:FireDogeWebBrowser.FavouritesEntity.Favourites.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor used generally used to set the attributes
member.param: Is for the name of the website
Is for the URL of the website

member.name: M:FireDogeWebBrowser.FavouritesEntity.Favourites.#ctor
member.summary: Empty constructor
member.remarks: It is mandatory for the serialization

member.name: M:FireDogeWebBrowser.FavouritesEntity.Favourites.Add(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This methods allows us to add an item to our custom list
member.remarks: As we encapsulated a List we need to define some methods to access items of that list

member.name: M:FireDogeWebBrowser.FavouritesEntity.Favourites.toList
member.summary: This methods allows us to extract our items as a list of HistoryEntity
member.remarks: As we encapsulated a List we need to define some methods to access items of that list

member.name: M:FireDogeWebBrowser.FavouritesEntity.Favourites.WriteXML
member.summary: This methods serializes the object into a XML file
member.remarks: This is the main purpose of this class: being serialized

member.name: M:FireDogeWebBrowser.FavouritesEntity.Favourites.ReadXML
member.summary: This methods deserializes the object from a XML file
member.remarks: This is the main purpose of this class: being deserialized

member.name: T:FireDogeWebBrowser.NavigationList`1
member.summary: This class derives from a simple List<T> class and is an enhenced version of it. We added methods to move through the list and everything is hidden to the user
member.typeparam: There is no restriction for the type used

member.name: P:FireDogeWebBrowser.NavigationList`1.CurrnetIndex
member.summary: This method returns the current index where we stand in the list

member.name: P:FireDogeWebBrowser.NavigationList`1.MoveNext
member.summary: This method gives the next item in the list

member.name: P:FireDogeWebBrowser.NavigationList`1.MovePrevious
member.summary: This method gives the previous item in the list

member.name: P:FireDogeWebBrowser.NavigationList`1.Current
member.summary: This method gives the current item in the list

member.name: T:FireDogeWebBrowser.Tab
member.summary: This class is used to define a Tab of our web browser. So we can use it like a unique entity composed of many various controls
member.remarks: This class derives from TabPage which defines an empry Tab. We want the same behaviour for our custom Tab

member.name: F:FireDogeWebBrowser.Tab.obj
member.summary: This property is used to have a reference of Main (initially Form1) So we can perform actions on it and call methods
member.remarks: This makes the Designer crash beacause Main instancies some Tab objetcs which references themselves Main But so far it compiles and works

member.name: F:FireDogeWebBrowser.Tab.color
member.summary: This attribute is used to define the color in the ribbon
member.remarks: It possibly can have all the valid values for a RGB color.

member.name: P:FireDogeWebBrowser.Tab.goPreviousBtn
member.summary: This button is used to go to the previous URL
member.remarks: The accessibility level is protected internal so we can access the button within the assembly and perform actions on it Also internal, in case we need a derived type of this class

member.name: P:FireDogeWebBrowser.Tab.goNextBtn
member.summary: This button is used to go to the next URL we can visit
member.remarks: The accessibility level is protected internal so we can access the button within the assembly and perform actions on it Also internal, in case we need a derived type of this class

member.name: P:FireDogeWebBrowser.Tab.reloadBtn
member.summary: This button is used to perform a GET request at the specified URL
member.remarks: The accessibility level is protected internal so we can access the button within the assembly and perform actions on it Also internal, in case we need a derived type of this class

member.name: P:FireDogeWebBrowser.Tab.urlEntry
member.summary: This textox is used to enter a URL
member.remarks: The accessibility level is protected internal so we can access the button within the assembly and perform actions on it Also internal, in case we need a derived type of this class

member.name: P:FireDogeWebBrowser.Tab.htmlDisplay
member.summary: This button is used to display the HTML we received from the GET request
member.remarks: The accessibility level is protected internal so we can access the button within the assembly and perform actions on it Also internal, in case we need a derived type of this class

member.name: P:FireDogeWebBrowser.Tab.localHistory
member.summary:
This list is used to have logs of the pages visited with the current tab
It is useful for the Previous and Next buttons

member.name: T:FireDogeWebBrowser.Request
member.summary: We don't need to instantiate this class as all its methods are defined with static

member.name: M:FireDogeWebBrowser.Request.getRequest(System.String,FireDogeWebBrowser.Tab)
member.summary:
Sends a GET request to a website The url of the targeted website The tab 'from which' we send the request
This method is marked with async Task to have an asynchronous method GetResponseAsync() this way the UI isn't blocked by the GET and its callback

member.name: M:FireDogeWebBrowser.Request.CreateRequest(FireDogeWebBrowser.HistoryEntity.History,FireDogeWebBrowser.Tab)
member.summary:
Sends a GET request to a website The global history of the browser The tab 'from which' we send the request
This method is marked with async to have an asynchronous method getRequest() The purpose of the function is to add the url to the history and make sure we have a valid URI

member.name: M:FireDogeWebBrowser.Request.formatUrl(System.String)
member.summary:
Formats a string into a proper url A string that may not be a correct url
We just add the missing parts of a correct url scheme.
